statement.p: Linda decides to order a pizza and wants to determine whether a medium, which costs 12.49, or a large, which costs 15.49 is the better deal.
Here are the medium (left) and large (right) pizzas.
The diameter of the large pizza is times as large as the medium pizza.
What is the area of the medium pizza? Round your answer to the nearest tenth. \displaystyle\text{in}^{{2}}
What is the area of the large pizza? Round your answer to the nearest tenth. \displaystyle\text{in}^{{2}}
The area of the large pizza is times as large as the medium pizza.
If the medium pizza costs 12.49 , how much should the large pizza cost to have each square inch of pizza be of equal value? Round your answer to the nearest cent.
Recall that the costs of the pizzas were 12.49 and 15.49. Which pizza is the better deal? (The better deal has a more pizza per dollar.)

ol.li: They are the same price per square inch.
